[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704194328/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typography "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typography")

BTW, the word “typography” does not refer to a single kind of practitioner, e.g.

<cite>Typography is performed by typesetters, compositors, typographers, graphic artists, art directors, and clerical workers. Until the Digital Age, typography was a specialized occupation. Digitization opened up typography to new generations of visual designers and lay users.</cite>

Have fun!
Check out the first 40 pages of _American Type Design and Designers_ by David Consuegra.
Which 100 years? Fake the teacher out and deal with the first 100.
